I myself have no "formal" education in Japanese history, I just read 
and research Japanese history because I find it extremely 
interesting. I've read a few books on Japanese history and I'm 
constantly searching the internet for facts. Just recently I've 
found this group, which has acted as both a source of knowledge, and 
an outlet to express my knowledge.

And Hello back

--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "dnastaj" <dnastaj@y...> 
wrote:
> A new poster's question. Does anyone who frequents this discussion 
> group have any formal experience in the field of historical japan? 
Or 
> are the majority just people of appreciation?
> 
> Either way is cool to me. I just find the vast range of the 
knowledge 
> of you all extremely remarkable. It's very inspiring to read this 
> discussion board.
> 
> Oh, and, Hello.
> 
> ;)
> 
> - DNastaj
